content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand and to solve. Great job. Your solution is working and mine too.

I agree that you should mention the possible rotation in the alphabet

Also, I would rephrase the example the other way around to enhance comprehension,
---
For example, you are given an encoded word "fcvc"
To decode it,
- f would decode to e
- c would decode to a
- v would decode to s
- c would decode to y
The flag to output is "easy"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me.

Goal section
* Suggest to format "easy", "e", "f", "a", "c", "s", "v", "y" and "fcvc" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks. If you choose not to apply the formatting, please at least add back the missing closed quotation marks.

* Please mention that the shifting works on a wrap-around basis, i.e. we go back to {{a}} after we reach {{z}}.

Constraints section
* Please mention that [[w]] contains lowercase letters only.

Thanks.
Please follow up the comments above. Thanks.
